title: U.S. congressman loses bet, forced to sing Mets fight song
text:
U.S. congressman loses bet, forced to sing Mets fight song 
Postmedia Network Friday, October 23, 2015 02:52 PM EDT | Updated: Friday, October 23, 2015 02:58 PM EDT House Benghazi Committee member Rep. Adam Schiff, D-Calif. speaks to the media on Capitol Hill in Washington on Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015, during a break in the testimony of Democratic presidential candidate, former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton before the committee. (AP Photo/Jacquelyn Martin) MLB Playoffs 
U.S. Democratic congressman Adam Schiff was forced to sing the New York Mets fight song Friday, after losing a bet with another representative. 
"Mr. Speaker, I rise today to congratulate Congressman Steve Israel and his beloved New York Mets after they defeated the Los Angeles Dodgers last week," said Schiff, who's from a southern California district (and took part in Thursday's marathon grilling of Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton before the Benghazi committee). 
"I lost a bet with Congressman Israel, so now Steve, this song is for you." 
At the end of the song, which Schiff appeared to sing half-heartedly, he ended it with, "Mr. Speaker, please tell me my time has expired." 
Schiff also said he was happy to see the Mets in the World Series and not their American League rivals the New York Yankees.
